Anthropogenic activities directly or indirectly stimulate the spread of many invasive species. Studies show that among toxic invasive plants, plants producing PAs and other alkaloids are the most common
83 . For example, the genus Cytisus comprises about 50 species of invasive PA-producing flowering plants. Many other plant-produced toxic alkaloids can be stable in water, like alkaloids entailing toxic persistent heterocyclic triazole rings.
